style.name: Major Title Level 2
style.info: Introduction major title, level 2

style.name: Margin, No First Line Indent
style.info: Paragraph text, with no first line indent (may occur after poetry)

style.name: * Secondary Language or Text Source
style.info: To represent where the original text is in a secondary language or from an alternate text source

style.name: * Endnote
style.info: An Endnote text item.

style.name: Table of Contents
style.info: Front matter table of contents.

style.name: Outline Level 2
style.info: Introduction outline text, level 2

style.name: Closure of an Epistle
style.info: Closure of an Epistle

style.name: * Small Caps
style.info: A character style, for small capitalization text

style.name: Paragraph Mark
style.info: (*) A Footnote additional paragraph marker.

style.name: * Emphasized Text
style.info: A character style, use emphasized text style

style.name: * Footnote Mark
style.info: An additional footnote marker location for a previous footnote.

style.name: Poetry Level 1
style.info: Introduction poetry text, level 1 (if single level)

style.name: * Bold Text
style.info: A character style, use bold text

style.name: Blank Line
style.info: May be used to explicitely indicate additional white space between paragraphs. Poetry text stanza break (e.g. stanza break)

style.name: Publication Data
style.info: Front matter publication data.

style.name: Paragraph
style.info: Introduction prose paragraph

style.name: Indented, Level 1, First Line Indent
style.info: Paragraph text, level 1 indent (if sinlge level), with first line indent; often used for discourse

style.name: Preface
style.info: Front matter preface.

style.name: Spine
style.info: Other peripheral materials - spine.

style.name: Section Heading Level 2
style.info: Introduction section heading, level 2

style.name: Paragraph, quote from text
style.info: Introduction prose paragraph, quote from the body text

style.name: Cover
style.info: Other peripheral materials - cover.

style.name: Front/Back Matter Paragraph Level 2
style.info: Front or back matter text paragraph, level 2 (if multiple levels)

style.name: Indented Paragraph, first line indent
style.info: Introduction prose paragraph, indented, with first line indent

style.name: Indented, Level 3, First Line Indent
style.info: Paragraph text, level 3 indent, with first line indent; often used for discourse

style.name: Section Heading Level 4
style.info: A section heading, level 4

style.name: [Uncommon] Major Title Ending Level 2
style.info: A secondary title occurring before or after the 'ending' main title

style.name: Major Section Level 1
style.info: A major section division heading, level 1 (if multiple levels)

style.name: Right Running Header
style.info: Running header text, right side of page

style.name: Outline Level 1
style.info: Introduction outline text, level 1 (if single level)

style.name: Outline References Range
style.info: Introduction references range for outline entry; for marking references separately

style.name: Blank Line
style.info: Introduction blank line

style.name: * DC Target Refs
style.info: Cross-reference target reference(s), Apocrypha only.

style.name: Chapter Number
style.info: Chapter number

style.name: Paragraph, no first line indent
style.info: Introduction prose paragraph, with no first line indent (may occur after poetry)

style.name: List Entry Level 2
style.info: A list entry, level 2

style.name: List Entry Level 4
style.info: A list entry, level 4

style.name: Major Title Level 2
style.info: A secondary title with less important information than the main title.

style.name: Publication Information
style.info: Publication information - Lang,Credit,Version,Copies,Publisher,Id,Logo Not yet supported in Bibledit.

style.name: Section Heading Range References
style.info: A section division references range heading

style.name: Outline Title
style.info: Introduction outline title

style.name: * Cross Reference
style.info: A list of cross references.

style.name: Acrostic Heading/Marker
style.info: Poetry text, Acrostic marker/heading

style.name: Section Heading Level 1
style.info: Introduction section heading, level 1 (if single level)

style.name: Right Aligned
style.info: Poetry text, Right Aligned

style.name: Major Title Level 3
style.info: Introduction major title, level 3

style.name: * Translational Addition
style.info: For a translational addition to the text

style.name: * Footnote
style.info: A Footnote text item.

style.name: Chapter Description
style.info: Chapter Description (Publishing option D, e.g. in Russian Bibles)

style.name: Embedded Verse Number
style.info: (*) A verse number within the footnote text.

style.name: Outline Level 1
style.info: Introduction outline text, level 1 (if multiple levels)

style.name: Embedded Text, Indent Level 2
style.info: Poetry text, embedded, level 2 indent

style.name: Major Section Level 2
style.info: A major section division heading, level 2

style.name: Indented, No First Line Indent
style.info: Paragraph text, indented, with no first line indent; often used for discourse

style.name: Outline Level 3
style.info: Introduction outline text, level 3

style.name: * Keyword
style.info: For a keyword

style.name: Running Header
style.info: Running header text for a book

style.name: * Selah
style.info: Poetry text, Selah

style.name: Embedded Text, Indent Level 1, Single Level Only
style.info: Poetry text, embedded, level 1 indent (if single level)

style.name: * Deuterocanonical/LXX Additions
style.info: Deuterocanonical/LXX additions or insertions in the Protocanonical text

style.name: Indented, Level 1, First Line Indent
style.info: Paragraph text, level 1 indent (if multiple levels), with first line indent; often used for discourse

style.name: Major Section Level 1
style.info: A major section division heading, level 1 (if single level)

style.name: * Figure/Illustration/Map
style.info: Illustration [Columns to span, height, filename, caption text]

style.name: Outline Level 4
style.info: Introduction outline text, level 4

style.name: Front/Back Matter Paragraph Level 1
style.info: Front or back matter text paragraph, level 1 (if multiple levels)

style.name: * Italic Text
style.info: A character style, use italic text

style.name: Quotation
style.info: (*) A cross-reference quotation from the scripture text.

style.name: * Acrostic Letter
style.info: Poetry text, Acrostic markup of the first character of a line of acrostic poetry

style.name: Poetry Level 1
style.info: Introduction poetry text, level 1 (if multiple levels)

style.name: Origin Reference
style.info: (*) The cross reference origin reference.

style.name: * Proper Name
style.info: For a proper name

style.name: Reference
style.info: (*) The origin reference for the footnote.

style.name: * Ordinal number text portion
style.info: For the text portion of an ordinal number

style.name: Text
style.info: (*) Footnote text.

style.name: Quotation or Alternate Rendering
style.info: (*) A footnote scripture quote.

style.name: Indented Paragraph, no first line indent
style.info: Introduction prose paragraph text, indented, with no first line indent

style.name: Major Title level 4
style.info: A small secondary title sometimes occuring within parentheses

style.name: Major Section Range References
style.info: A major section division references range heading

style.name: Major Title Level 3
style.info: A secondary title, less important than the main title

style.name: * Normal Text
style.info: A character style, use normal text

style.name: Section Heading Level 1
style.info: Introduction section heading, level 1 (if multiple levels)

style.name: * Quoted Text, OT in NT
style.info: For Old Testament quoted text appearing in the New Testament

style.name: Section Heading Level 2
style.info: A section heading, level 2 (e.g. Proverbs 22-24)

style.name: List Entry Level 3
style.info: A list entry, level 3

style.name: Target References
style.info: (*) The cross reference target reference(s).

style.name: Embedded Text, Indent Level 1
style.info: Poetry text, embedded, level 1 indent (if multiple levels)

style.name: Running Header
style.info: Running header text

style.name: Embedded Text Refrain
style.info: Embedded text refrain (e.g. Then all the people shall say, "Amen!")

style.name: Indented, Level 2, First Line Indent
style.info: Paragraph text, level 2 indent, with first line indent; often used for discourse

style.name: * Publishing alternate verse
style.info: Published verse marker - this is a verse marking that would be used in the published text.

style.name: List Entry Level 1
style.info: A list entry, level 1 (if single level)

style.name: Paragraph, right aligned
style.info: Introduction prose paragraph, right aligned

style.name: Remark
style.info: Comments and remarks

style.name: Major Title Level 1
style.info: Introduction major title, level 1 (if single level)

style.name: Major Title Level 4
style.info: Introduction major title, level 4 (usually within parenthesis)

style.name: Indent Level 1, Single Level Only
style.info: Poetry text, level 1 indent (if single level)

style.name: Indent Level 2
style.info: Poetry text, level 2 indent

style.name: Explanatory or Bridge Text
style.info: Introduction explanatory or bridge text (e.g. explanation of missing book in Short Old Testament)

style.name: Poetry Level 3
style.info: Introduction poetry text, level 3

style.name: Centered
style.info: Poetry text, centered

style.name: Indent Level 3
style.info: Poetry text, level 3 indent

style.name: Label Text
style.info: (*) A footnote label text item, for marking or "labelling" the type or alternate translation being provided in the note.

style.name: Concordance
style.info: Back matter concordance.

style.name: * Quoted book title
style.info: For the quoted name of a book

style.name: Embedded Text
style.info: Embedded text paragraph

style.name: Descriptive Title, Hebrew Subtitle
style.info: A Hebrew text heading, to provide description (e.g. Psalms)

style.name: * Liturgical note
style.info: For a comment or note inserted for liturgical use

style.name: Paragraph, quote from text, no first line indent
style.info: Introduction prose paragraph, quote from the body text, with no first line indent

style.name: [Uncommon] Major Title Ending Level 1
style.info: The main title of the book repeated at the end of the book (if multiple levels)

style.name: End Marker
style.info: Introduction ending marker

style.name: Page Break
style.info: Page Break used for new reader portions and children bibles where content is controlled by the page

style.name: Alternate Rendering
style.info: (*) A footnote alternate rendering for a portion of scripture text.

style.name: Section Heading Level 3
style.info: A section heading, level 3 (e.g. Genesis "The First Day")

style.name: Short Table of Contents Text
style.info: Short table of contents text

style.name: Embedded Text, Indent Level 3
style.info: Poetry text, embedded, level 3 indent

style.name: * Transliterated Word
style.info: For transliterated words

style.name: Major Title Level 1
style.info: Introduction major title, level 1 (if multiple levels)

style.name: Embedded Text Closing
style.info: Embedded text closing

style.name: Glossary
style.info: Back matter glossary.

style.name: Index
style.info: Back matter index.

style.name: Concordance Keyword Level 2
style.info: Concordance main entry text or keyword, level 2

style.name: Long Table of Contents Text
style.info: Long table of contents text

style.name: Embedded Text Opening
style.info: Embedded text opening

style.name: Normal, First Line Indent
style.info: Paragraph text, with first line indent

style.name: Left Running Header
style.info: Running header text, left side of page

style.name: * Name of Deity
style.info: For name of diety

style.name: Speaker
style.info: A heading, to identify the speaker (e.g. Job)

style.name: * DC text
style.info: Footnote text, applies to Apocrypha only.

style.name: Keyword
style.info: (*) A cross reference keyword.

style.name: Map Index
style.info: Back matter map index.

style.name: List Entry Level 1
style.info: A list entry, level 1 (if multiple levels)

style.name: Indent Level 1
style.info: Poetry text, level 1 indent (if multiple levels)

style.name: * Author Signature (Epistles)
style.info: For the signature of the author of an Epistle

style.name: Major Title Level 1
style.info: The main title of the book (if multiple levels)

style.name: * Alternate verse number
style.info: Second (alternate) verse number (for coding dual numeration in Psalms; see also NRSV Exo 22.1-4)

style.name: Centered (for Inscription)
style.info: Paragraph text, centered (for Inscription)

style.name: Section Heading Level 1
style.info: A section heading, level 1 (if multiple levels)

style.name: [Uncommon] Major Title Ending Level 1
style.info: The main title of the book repeated at the end of the book (if single level)

style.name: Major Title Level 1
style.info: The main title of the book (if single level)

style.name: Section Heading Level 1
style.info: A section heading, level 1 (if single level)

style.name: Introduction
style.info: Front matter introduction.

style.name: Encoding
style.info: File encoding information Bibledit disregards this marker, as all text in Bibledit are in UTF-8 encoding.

style.name: Keyword
style.info: (*) A footnote keyword.

style.name: * BoldItalic Text
style.info: A character style, use bold + italic text

style.name: Poetry Level 2
style.info: Introduction poetry text, level 2

style.name: No Break with Previous Paragraph
style.info: Paragraph text, with no break from previous paragraph text (at chapter boundary)

style.name: Concordance Keyword Level 1
style.info: Concordance main entry text or keyword, level 1

style.name: [Uncommon] Major Title at Introduction End
style.info: Introduction major title at introduction end

style.name: Identification
style.info: File identification information (BOOKID, FILENAME, EDITOR, MODIFICATION DATE)

style.name: Verse Number
style.info: A verse number (Necessary for normal Bibledit operation)

style.name: * Words of Jesus
style.info: For marking the words of Jesus

style.name: Book Abbreviation
style.info: Book Abbreviation (not yet supported by Bibledit).

style.name: Inline Quotation References
style.info: A cross-reference indicating the source text for the preceding quotation.

style.name: Row
style.info: A new table row.

style.info: A table heading, column 1.

style.info: A table heading, column 2.

style.info: A table heading, column 4.

style.info: A table heading, column 1, right aligned.

style.info: A table heading, column 2, right aligned.

style.info: A table heading, column 3, right aligned.

style.name: Column 4 Heading, Right Aligned
style.info: A table heading, column 4, right aligned.

style.info: A table cell item, column 1.

style.info: A table cell item, column 4.

style.info: A table cell item, column 1, right aligned.

style.info: A table cell item, column 3, right aligned.

style.name: Column 4 Cell, Right Aligned
style.info: A table cell item, column 4, right aligned.

style.name: Alternate Chapter Number
style.info: Second (alternate) chapter number (for coding dual versification; useful for places where different traditions of chapter breaks need to be supported in the same translation). Bibledit does nothing with this marker yet.

style.name: Chapter Publishing Label
style.info: Chapter label used for translations that add a word such as "Chapter" before chapter numbers (e.g. Psalms).

style.name: Publishing Alternate Chapter Number
style.info: Published chapter number (this is a chapter marking that would be used in the published text).

style.name: * CJK Prounciation
style.info: For indicating pronunciation in CJK texts

style.name: * Hebrew Wordlist Entry
style.info: A Hebrew wordlist text item.

style.name: * Greek Wordlist Entry
style.info: A Greek Wordlist text item.

style.name: * Subject Index Entry
style.info: A subject index text item.

style.name: * Wordlist Entry
style.info: A wordlist text item.

style.name: Parallel References
style.info: Parallel reference(s)

style.name: Introduction List Entry Level 1
style.info: An introduction list entry, level 1 (if single level)

style.name: Introduction List Entry Level 1
style.info: An introduction list entry, level 1 (if multiple levels)

style.info: An introduction list entry, level 2
